meanings.definition: A descendant or follower of a notable person or group.
meanings.sent1: The epigon of the famous author continued the family legacy.
meanings.sent2: She was considered an epigon of her grandfather, who was a renowned artist.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly declared herself the epigon of her grandmother's baking skills.
meanings.sent4: As an epigon of the legendary warrior, he felt the weight of expectations on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The epigon of the king was determined to honor his ancestor's memory.

meanings.definition: A person who imitates or copies the style or ideas of someone else.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was often criticized for being an epigon of a famous painter.
meanings.sent2: She was known in the art world as an epigon of the avant-garde movement.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's impression of the president was so accurate, he was called an epigon by the audience.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, being labeled an epigon was seen as a compliment rather than an insult.
meanings.sent5: Her work was dismissed as mere epigonism, lacking originality and creativity.
